document_title: Rubella (German measles): Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content: Rubella is not dangerous, but if not prevented or treated, it can become severe: pain in the joints of the fingers, knees, wrists, encephalitis... In particular, pregnant women infected with the Rubella virus will transmit the disease to the fetus. children, causing deformities and lifelong effects.
subsection_data:
benh rubella.json. Is Rubella dangerous?
Rubella is not dangerous, but if not prevented or treated, it can become severe: pain in the joints of the fingers, knees, wrists, encephalitis... In particular, pregnant women infected with the Rubella virus will transmit the disease to the fetus. children, causing deformities and lifelong effects.
